ai.summary: A short, easy 4.8 km hike in the UK suitable for beginners, with gentle terrain and straightforward navigation.
ai.terrain_summary: Mostly easy, well-maintained trails with a mix of compact dirt and gravel. Gentle inclines and flat sections make footing comfortable for walkers of all levels.
ai.safety_notes: Check the forecast and daylight hours before you go. Wear sturdy footwear and carry a waterproof layer. Stay on marked paths, bring a map or device with offline access, and have a means of signaling for help (phone or whistle). Hydrate and pace yourself, especially in warmer weather. Dogs should be kept under control where required.
recommended_gear: Comfortable walking shoes or hiking boots
Weather-appropriate clothing and a light rain jacket
Map or GPS / fully charged phone
ai.best_seasons: Spring through autumn; winter hikes are possible with proper preparation and daylight.
